DrawOffset: vertical offset added to navmesh's debug representation for better readability
TilePoolSize: maximum number of tiles NavMesh can hold
TileSizeUU: size of single tile, expressed in uu
NavMeshResolutionParams:
Resolution params
If using multiple resolutions, it's recommended to chose the highest resolution first and
set it according to the highest desired precision and then the other resolutions.
AgentRadius: Radius of smallest agent to traverse this navmesh
AgentHeight: Size of the tallest agent that will path with this navmesh.
AgentMaxSlope: The maximum slope (angle) that the agent can move on.
MinRegionArea: The minimum dimension of area. Areas smaller than this will be discarded
MergeRegionSize: The size limit of regions to be merged with bigger regions (watershed partitioning only)
MaxVerticalMergeError:
Maximum vertical deviation between raw contour points to allowing merging (in voxel).
Use a low value (2-5) depending on CellHeight, AgentMaxStepHeight and AgentMaxSlope, to allow more precise contours (also see SimplificationElevationRatio).
Use very high value to deactivate (Recast behavior).
MaxSimplificationError: How much navigable shapes can get simplified - the higher the value the more freedom
SimplificationElevationRatio:
When simplifying contours, how much is the vertical error taken into account when comparing with MaxSimplificationError.
Use 0 to deactivate (Recast behavior), use 1 as a typical value.
MaxSimultaneousTileGenerationJobsCount: Sets the limit for number of asynchronous tile generators running at one time, also used for some synchronous tasks
TileNumberHardLimit:
Absolute hard limit to number of navmesh tiles. Be very, very careful while modifying it while
    having big maps with navmesh. A single, empty tile takes 176 bytes and empty tiles are
    allocated up front (subject to change, but that's where it's at now)
    @note TileNumberHardLimit is always rounded up to the closest power of 2
NavMeshOriginOffset: Use this if you don't want your tiles to start at (0,0,0)
LedgeSlopeFilterMode: filtering methode used for filtering ledge slopes
RegionPartitioning: partitioning method for creating navmesh polys
LayerPartitioning: partitioning method for creating tile layers
RegionChunkSplits: number of chunk splits (along single axis) used for region's partitioning: ChunkyMonotone
LayerChunkSplits: number of chunk splits (along single axis) used for layer's partitioning: ChunkyMonotone
TimeSliceFilterLedgeSpansMaxYProcess: The maximum number of y coords to process when time slicing filter ledge spans during navmesh regeneration.
TimeSliceLongDurationDebug: If a single time sliced section of navmesh regen code exceeds this duration then it will trigger debug logging
InvokerTilePriorityBumpDistanceThreshold: If >= 1, when sorting pending tiles by priority, tiles near invokers (within the distance threshold) will have their priority increased.
InvokerTilePriorityBumpIncrease: Priority increase steps for tiles that are withing near distance.
HeuristicScale: Euclidean distance heuristic scale used while pathfinding
VerticalDeviationFromGroundCompensation: Value added to each search height to compensate for error between navmesh polys and walkable geometry
bDrawTriangleEdges: Draw edges of every navmesh's triangle
bDrawPolyEdges: Draw edges of every poly (i.e. not only border-edges)
bDrawFilledPolys: if disabled skips filling drawn navmesh polygons
bDrawPathCollidingGeometry: Draw input geometry passed to the navmesh generator.  Recommend disabling other geometry rendering via viewport showflags in editor.
bDrawPolygonLabels: Draw a label for every poly that indicates its poly and tile indices
bDrawDefaultPolygonCost: Draw a label for every poly that indicates its default and fixed costs
bDrawPolygonFlags: Draw a label for every poly that indicates its poly and area flags
bDrawClusters: Draw navmesh's clusters and cluster links. (Requires WITH_NAVMESH_CLUSTER_LINKS=1)
bDrawOctree: Draw octree used to store navigation relevant actors
bDrawOctreeDetails: Draw octree used to store navigation relevant actors with the elements bounds
bFixedTilePoolSize: if true, the NavMesh will allocate fixed size pool for tiles, should be enabled to support streaming
bSortNavigationAreasByCost:
Controls whether Navigation Areas will be sorted by cost before application
    to navmesh during navmesh generation. This is relevant when there are
    areas overlapping and we want to have area cost express area relevancy
    as well. Setting it to true will result in having area sorted by cost,
    but it will also increase navmesh generation cost a bit
bIsWorldPartitioned: In a world partitioned map, is this navmesh using world partitioning
bPerformVoxelFiltering:
controls whether voxel filtering will be applied (via FRecastTileGenerator::ApplyVoxelFilter).
    Results in generated navmesh better fitting navigation bounds, but hits (a bit) generation performance
bMarkLowHeightAreas: mark areas with insufficient free height above instead of cutting them out (accessible only for area modifiers using replace mode)
bUseExtraTopCellWhenMarkingAreas:
Expand the top of the area nav modifier's bounds by one cell height when applying to the navmesh.
              If unset, navmesh on top of surfaces might not be marked by marking bounds flush with top surfaces (since navmesh is generated slightly above collision, depending on cell height).
bFilterLowSpanSequences: if set, only single low height span will be allowed under valid one
bFilterLowSpanFromTileCache: if set, only low height spans with corresponding area modifier will be stored in tile cache (reduces memory, can't modify without full tile rebuild)
bDoFullyAsyncNavDataGathering: if set, navmesh data gathering will never happen on the game thread and will only be done on background threads

methods.name: ReplaceAreaInTileBounds
methods.doc: @return true if any polygon/link has been touched
